TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AudienceOperator extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the definition of an audience operator.

remarks.para: The AudienceOperator class represents an individual operator that is allowed as part of a rule definition. The list of allowed operators includes "=," ">," ">=," "<," "<=," "Contains," "Reports Under," "<>," "Not contains," "AND," "OR," "(," ")," and "Member of." New operators require the following information: the display name (if operator is used from the user interface), the operator name used by the audience objects, and whether the operator can be applied to a group or whether it is a "NOT" operator. Valid group operations are determined by the enumeration, and include "AND," "OR," "(," and ")."
This object can be instantiated only by the object. Use the property to retrieve the correct object.

example.para: The following code example adds complex rules for an audience called "John and Joe Connection". This example uses AND, OR, and ( and ) operators to combine multiple rules and to group rules.
Note: If you create an audience with complex rules, you cannot view or edit its properties or delete it by using the user interface. However, you can use the user interface to view its membership.
Replace servername and other strings with actual values before running the code example. Also add the following references in your Microsoft Visual Studio project:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property bGroupOperator As Boolean
public: property bool bGroupOperator { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a flag that indicates whether the operator portion of the audience rule is a group operator or a "NOT" operator.
Docs.value: A Boolean value. true if the operator is a group operator; false if the operator is a "NOT" operator.

remarks.para: The property is read-only. Valid group operations are contained in the enumeration, and include "AND," "OR," "(," and ")."

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OperatorDisplayName As String
public: property System::String ^ OperatorDisplayName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the display name for the audience operator that appears in the user interface (UI).
Docs.value: A string that gets the display name for the audience operator.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OperatorName As String
public: property System::String ^ OperatorName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the operator portion of the audience rule.
Docs.value: String that represents the operator name.
